fields.description:
When I run empyrean-describe-services \-\-by\-zone to get a list of services broken down by availability zone I get output resembling the following:

{code}
SERVICE  ZONE             TYPE                  NAME                            
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  autoscaling           API_10.111.1.11.autoscaling     
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  cloudformation        API_10.111.1.11.cloudformation  
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  cloudwatch            API_10.111.1.11.cloudwatch      
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  compute               API_10.111.1.11.compute         
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  euare                 API_10.111.1.11.euare           
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  identity              API_10.111.1.11.identity        
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  imaging               API_10.111.1.11.imaging         
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  loadbalancing         API_10.111.1.11.loadbalancing   
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  objectstorage         API_10.111.1.11.objectstorage   
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  simpleworkflow        API_10.111.1.11.simpleworkflow  
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  tokens                API_10.111.1.11.tokens          
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.11  user-api              API_10.111.1.11                 
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  autoscaling           API_10.111.1.16.autoscaling     
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  cloudformation        API_10.111.1.16.cloudformation  
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  cloudwatch            API_10.111.1.16.cloudwatch      
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  compute               API_10.111.1.16.compute         
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  euare                 API_10.111.1.16.euare           
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  identity              API_10.111.1.16.identity        
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  imaging               API_10.111.1.16.imaging         
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  loadbalancing         API_10.111.1.16.loadbalancing   
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  objectstorage         API_10.111.1.16.objectstorage   
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  simpleworkflow        API_10.111.1.16.simpleworkflow  
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  tokens                API_10.111.1.16.tokens          
SERVICE  API_10.111.1.16  user-api              API_10.111.1.16                 
SERVICE  bootstrap        bootstrap             10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  bootstrap        reporting             10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       autoscalingbackend    10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       cloudwatchbackend     10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       dns                   10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       eucalyptus            10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       imagingbackend        10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       jetty                 10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       loadbalancingbackend  10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       notifications         10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  eucalyptus       pollednotifications   10.111.1.11                     
SERVICE  one              cluster               one-cc-1                        
SERVICE  one              storage               one-sc-1                        
SERVICE  two              cluster               two-cc-1                        
SERVICE  two              storage               two-sc-1                        
SERVICE  walrus           walrusbackend         walrus-1                        
{code}

To display services' availability zones the tool winds up looking at their partitions, but most of the partitions are completely irrelevant.  The ones that start with API are due to shoehorning by the user-api service group implementation, and others are essentially global or host-only things that date back to eucalyptus 3.0.  The only ones with that are meaningful to a cloud admin are the ones for the cluster and storage controllers, which he or she chose manually while registering them.  How can we reduce the clutter here so that column can be more useful?
fields.summary: Most of the partitions that show up in DescribeServicesResponseType messages are useless to administrators
